extendedIngredients.name: feta cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 packages (4 ounces each) crumbled tomato and basil feta cheese

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 block (8 ounces) Monterey Jack cheese, cubed

extendedIngredients.name: olives
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (3.8 ounces) sliced ripe olives, drained

extendedIngredients.name: spice blend
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 packages (16 ounces each) frozen California-blend vegetables, thawed

extendedIngredients.name: spiral pasta
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 packages (12 ounces each) tricolor spiral pasta

extendedIngredients.name: yellow summer squash
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large yellow summer squash, quartered and thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: zucchini
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large zucchini, halved and thinly sliced

recipes.title: Italian Dressing Pasta Salad
recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse with cold water; drain well. In two large bowls, combine the California vegetables, tomatoes, zucchini, yellow squash, onion, cheeses and pasta.                                                                                            In a small bowl, combine the salad dressing, parsley, basil, Italian seasoning, seasoned salt and pepper. Pour over pasta mixture; toss to coat. Stir in olives. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight.                                                                                            Toss before serving. Serve with Romano cheese if desired.                                        Yield: 36 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Rainbow Pasta Salad in  Country WomanAugust/September 2007, p27                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (3/4 cup) equals 157 calories, 10 g fat (3 g saturated fat), 15 mg cholesterol, 405 mg sodium, 11 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 5 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse with cold water; drain well. In two large bowls, combine the California vegetables, tomatoes, zucchini, yellow squash, onion, cheeses and pasta.
In a small bowl, combine the salad dressing, parsley, basil, Italian seasoning, seasoned salt and pepper.
Pour over pasta mixture; toss to coat. Stir in olives. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight.
Serve with Romano cheese if desired.
